experience: You and Jason both know Erika Flora PMP, PgMP, ITIL Expert,PRINCE2,CSP, Beth Gray (Newberg), CSM, and 10 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

Manages various projects from initiation to implementation; Owns the schedule, drives intermediate deliverables and ensures project commitments are met across multiple teams and geographic locations; Responsible for project coordination, developing schedule plans, status reporting and issue escalation; Defines and tracks weekly work goals to ensure activities and priorities meet expectations; Maintains visibility on day-to-day activities with project teams and ensures sufficient interaction with key stakeholders; Escalates and drives issues to resolution; Engages with client leadership to ensure proper expectation setting and to fully understand requirements; Mitigates risks and addresses program / project obstacles as needed.

Client: iHeartMEDIA / Clear Channel Outdoor (January 2013 - February 2016)iHeartMEDIAProgram managed the efforts of multiple back to back salesforce.com projects involving vendor and multiple cross-functional teams to build upon initial rollout to national sales team; Enhancements (account searches, address validations, automated account data mastering integration, manual data stewardship, and enterprise credit capcability) were multi-phasedClear Channel OutdoorCollaborated, facilitated, led and coached a scrum team responsible for developing enhancements and addressing production issues to an outdoor digital billboard content management system; Led business and operational resources to upgrade company's digital billboard infrastructure by converting communications from satellite to cellular network; Managed a digital asset management migration from an antiquated platform to a newer cloud-based platform; Drove forward multiple video stream connectivity tests across 220+ locations in support of on-going corporate C-level town hallsClient: BMO Harris Bank (August 2009 - December 2012)Managed multiple cross-functional teams in parallel to ensure business operational readiness at branches and call centers to support high priority, customer impacting online banking and bill pay conversion and upgrade implementations; Emphasis on: marketing, internal communications, call center and branch procedures / processes, and training
Marketing / Project Manager - Retail Marketing Division

Developed go-to-market marketing strategies and tactical execution for home equity and provided project management to checking and debit card marketing programs.  Managed schedules, progress, and costs to ensure programs launched on time and within budget.  Supported programs with research, competitive insight, and industry trends.  Partnered with product, sales, legal, and finance teams to support P&L goals.  Managed the launch and communication of programs and provided analysis on program effectiveness.  Executed national and regional programs through collateral, merchandising, sales promotions, advertising, and direct marketing (online, email, direct mail, statements).
Program / Project Manager - Home Equity Division

Managed small to large technology projects, including a $10M multi-phased, cross-selling initiative that accelerated home equity originations through increased cross-sell opportunities and improved efficiencies in mortgage and equity lending across retail and home loans distribution channels.  Synchronized business and technology efforts through project planning, execution, monitoring, and resource balancing within a matrixed organizational structure.  Company Awards: Q3’2005 Manager Excellence,  Q4’2006 Elite Group Program

Project managed from requirements to implementation a $1.6M software development initiative that migrated an existing online consumer lending website from a Java based platform to a Microsoft .NET platform.Clients: Bonneville Power Administration and Washington Mutual

After working with Jason in a consultant role on a critical platform conversion, I sought him out to become a member of my team. Jason managed a growing team of project managers that became an elite team within Wamu, not only managing all of the Lending projects for the retail bank, but eventually for the entire retail bank. He was the go-to person for project and program management knowledge. Large, complex projects were successfully launched under Jason's watch with impacts to critical systems, services and customers. Soon after this success he migrated to Marketing leveraging his skills and expertise within the bank.

Working in a senior business analyst role, Bernie worked with me for almost 3 years at BMO Harris Bank.  I (and other line of business stakeholders) continuously relied on her to write [and later recall] detailed business requirements, review marketing materials for accuracy and clarity, provide feedback on priority of defects found in QA, and help identify employee / customer work arounds when a solution wasn't immediately available. Bernie has an amazing memory, is extremely detailed and analytical, and truly cares about the customer / user experience.  As a project manager, you rely on key individuals to get the work done.   Whether at a manager or executive level, you will quickly find Bernie within your group of key contributors.

June 14, 2012, Jason worked with Sarah in different groups

As a Line of Business Project Manager, I worked closely with Sarah to determine call center impacts to support small to large online banking and bill pay implementations.  I relied heavily on Sarah, as my call center manager, to identify, review, and approve servicing procedures and job aids, as well as identify training requirements necessary to support the various project implementations.  Sarah was very knowledgeable in online banking and bill pay functionality and the day to day call center activities of her more than 70 agents.  She was always approachable, easy to work with, and always kept a calm demeanor during times of stress.  Sarah repeatedly demonstrated her ability to resolve or mitigate issues and risks and always partnered with others to find alternatives and work arounds.  Sarah was instrumental to the success of my projects and I would gladly work with her again in the future.
